channel.title: One of those days
channel.description: Recent content on One of those days

item.title: Proxy and Reverse Proxy Terminology
item.description: Proxy and Reverse-Proxy are just networking terminology. It helps to visualize it as between client and server.

item.title: The Differences Between SSH and VPN
item.description: Secure SHell is an application implementation to securely communicate and give commands to remote host. It work at Application Layer.

item.title: My Naive Thoughts of CRUD and Chat Systems
item.description: Chatting in real-time invovled server-client communication. For example, PHP web is best for Create-Read-Update-Delete operation, but it is inefficient for chatting, as the client need to pool against the server for new data periodically. This would not scale for the server against the growth of user base.

item.title: My Naive Thoughts Four Module of Hadoop
item.description: Hadoop: A set of open source programs and procedures which anyone can use as the “backbone” of their big data operations.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Every-day life developer experience and over 10 years in home-and-friend-IT-free support, for life :’).

item.title: How Linux handles file permission
item.description: Linux (also known as GNU/Linux) is a clone of UNIX, the multi-user operating system which can be accessed by many users simultaneously. Linux can also be used in mainframes and servers without any modifications (and this attracts attackers).
